DataElement.preferredName: Audiometric Test Right Ear 3000 Hertz Threshold Result Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The value of the audiometric test of the right ear threshold for 3000 hertz.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Audiometric Test Right Ear 3000 Hertz Threshold
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Testing conducted utilizing a manual or microprocessor audiometer to test for hearing loss.:The organ of hearing located on the right side of the head._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::3000_A SI derived unit of frequency; equal to one oscillation (one cycle) per second._The lowest limit at which something becomes detectable or relevant.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Audiometric testing (hearing test) is conducted utilizing a manual or microprocessor audiometer. The test is usually carried out in a sound room or sound test chamber. Used to test for hearing loss.

Concepts.definition: Testing conducted utilizing a manual or microprocessor audiometer to test for hearing loss.

Property.preferredDefinition: The organ of hearing located on the right side of the head._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::3000_A SI derived unit of frequency; equal to one oscillation (one cycle) per second._The lowest limit at which something becomes detectable or relevant.

Concepts.definition: The organ of hearing located on the right side of the head.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A SI derived unit of frequency; equal to one oscillation (one cycle) per second.
The lowest limit at which something becomes detectable or relevant.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form
DataElementConcept.administrativeNotes: 2022-5-9 ak Released per LS review and approval.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Audiogram Testing Result in Decibels Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Result of audiogram testing; the decibel threshold level of each ear in response to measured frequency levels of sound.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
